data.title: Schedule of Upcoming and Announced Broadway Shows
data.meta_description: See what’s coming soon, what’s premiering out of town, and what’s in development.
data.text:
This list is updated regularly. It is organized by start of previews.

Playbill will update these listings when new information is made available. For a list of all Broadway-related COVID-19 protocols, please click here.

2024-2025 SEASON

THE ROOMMATE

Theatre: Booth Theatre

First Preview: August 29, 2024

Opening: September 12, 2024

Starring: Mia Farrow, Patti LuPone

Writer: Jen Silverman

Director: Jack O'Brien

About: Mia Farrow and Patti LuPone will return to Broadway in Jen Silverman's comedy about identity, morality, and the promise of reinvention.

MCNEAL

Theatre: Vivian Beaumont Theatre

First Preview: September 5, 2024

Opening: September 30, 2024

Starring: Robert Downey Jr., Brittany Bellizeare, Rafi Gavron, Melora Hardin, Andrea Martin, Ruthie Ann Miles, Saisha Talwar

Writer: Ayad Akhtar

Director: Bartlett Sher

About: Academy Award-winner Robert Downey Jr. will make his Broadway debut in Ayad Akhtar's new play about a great writer, his estranged son, and his unhealthy fascination with Artificial Intelligence.

THE HILLS OF CALIFORNIA

Theatre: Broadhurst Theatre

First Preview: September 11, 2024

Opening: September 29, 2024

Starring: Laura Donnelly, Leanne Best, Ophelia Lovibond, Helena Wilson, Nancy Allsop, Sophia Ally, Lara McDonnell, Nicola Turner

Writer: Jez Butterworth

Director: Sam Mendes

About: Jez Butterworth's new play comes to Broadway following its acclaimed run in London's West End.

YELLOW FACE

Theatre: Todd Haimes Theatre

First Preview: September 13, 2024

Opening: October 1, 2024

Starring: Daniel Dae Kim, Kevin Del Aguila, Ryan Eggold, Francis Jue, Marinda Anderson, Greg Keller, Shannon Tyo

Writer: David Henry Hwang

Director: Leigh Silverman

About: The Broadway premiere of David Henry Hwang's comedy about the complexities of race.

OUR TOWN

Theatre: Ethel Barrymore Theatre

First Preview: September 17, 2024

Opening: October 10, 2024

Starring: Jim Parsons, Zoey Deutch, Katie Holmes, Billy Eugene Jones, Ephraim Sykes, Richard Thomas, Michelle Wilson, Julie Halston, Donald Webber Jr.

Writer: Thornton Wilder

Director: Kenny Leon

About: Kenny Leon directs the first Broadway revival of Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning classic in nearly 25 years.

LEFT ON TENTH

Theatre: James Earl Jones Theatre

First Preview: September 26, 2024

Opening: October 23, 2024

Starring: Julianna Margulies, Peter Gallagher, Peter Francis James, Kate MacCluggage

Writer: Delia Ephron

Director: Susan Stroman

About: A new play based on Delia Ephron's memoir of the same name.

ROMEO AND JULIET

Theatre: Circle in the Square Theatre

First Preview: September 26, 2024

Opening: October 24, 2024

Starring: Kit Connor, Rachel Zegler

Writer: William Shakespeare

Director: Sam Gold

About: Kit Connor and Rachel Zegler will make their Broadway debuts in a new production of Shakespeare's beloved romantic tragedy.

SUNSET BOULEVARD

Theatre: St. James Theatre

First Preview: September 28, 2024

Opening: October 20, 2024

Starring: Nicole Scherzinger, Tom Francis, Grace Hodgett-Young, David Thaxton

Writers: Andrew Lloyd Webber (music), Don Black & Christopher Hampton (book and lyrics)

Director: Jamie Lloyd

About: The acclaimed West End revival of the musical adaptation of Billy Wilder's classic film is coming to Broadway in 2024.

MAYBE HAPPY ENDING

Theatre: Belasco Theatre

First Preview: October 16, 2024

Opening: November 12, 2024

Starring: Darren Criss, Helen J Shen, Dez Duron, Marcus Choi

Writers: Will Aronson (book and music), Hue Park (book and lyrics)

Director: Michael Arden

About: A new science-fiction musical about the developing relationship between two robots. It previously played in South Korea and at Atlanta's Alliance Theatre.

A WONDERFUL WORLD

Theatre: Studio 54

First Preview: October 16, 2024

Opening: November 11, 2024

Starring: James Monroe Iglehart, Darlesia Cearcy, Dionne Figgins, Kim Exum, Jennie Harney-Fleming

Writer: Aurin Squire

Director: Christopher Renshaw

About: A musical about the life of legendary jazz musician Louis Armstrong. The musical premiered in Miami Beach in Winter 2021 and played a pre-Broadway run in New Orleans in Fall 2023.

TAMMY FAYE

Theatre: Palace Theatre

First Preview: October 19, 2024

Opening: November 14, 2024

Starring: Katie Brayben, Christian Borle, Michael Cerveris

Writers: Elton John (music), Jake Shears (lyrics), James Graham (book)

Director: Rupert Goold

About: A musical about the life and career of televangelist Tammy Faye. The Olivier Award-nominated musical premiered at London's Alemeida Theatre in Fall 2022.

DEATH BECOMES HER

Theatre: Lunt-Fontanne Theatre

First Preview: October 23, 2024

Opening: November 21, 2024

Starring: Megan Hilty, Jennifer Simard, Christopher Sieber, Michelle Williams

Writers: Julia Mattison and Noel Carey (music and lyrics), Marco Pennette (book)

Director: Christopher Gattelli

About: A musical based on Robert Zemeckis' 1992 dark comedy film about eternal youth. A premiere production opened at Chicago's Cadillac Palace Theatre in April 2024.

SWEPT AWAY

Theatre: Longacre Theatre

First Preview: October 29, 2024

Opening: November 19, 2024

Writers: The Avett Brothers (music and lyrics), John Logan (book)

Director: Michael Mayer

About: A new musical about the survivors of an 1888 shipwreck off the coast of New Bedford, Massachusetts. The show previously played Berkeley Repertory Theatre and Washington, D.C.'s Arena Stage.

CULT OF LOVE

Theatre: Helen Hayes Theatre

First Preview: November 20, 2024

Opening: December 12, 2024

Writer: Leslye Headland

Director: Trip Cullman

About: Leslye Headland's play about a tempestuous family Christmas makes its Broadway debut. It previously played Williamstown Theatre Festival and Berkeley Repertory Theatre.

GYPSY

Theatre: Majestic Theatre

First Preview: November 21, 2024

Opening: December 19, 2024

Starring: Audra McDonald

Writers: Jule Styne (music), Stephen Sondheim (lyrics), Arthur Laurents (book)

Director: George C. Wolfe

About: Six-time Tony Award winner Audra McDonald returns to Broadway in the legendary role of Madame Rose in the timeless Broadway musical.

EUREKA DAY

Theatre: Samuel J. Friedman Theatre

First Preview: November 25, 2024

Opening: December 16, 2024

Starring: Zoë Chao, Amber Gray, Jessica Hecht, Bill Irwin, Thomas Middleditch

Writer: Jonathan Spector

Director: Anna D. Shapiro

About: The Broadway premiere of Jonathan Spector's comedy about a vaccination debate in a private California elementary school.

ENGLISH

Theatre: Todd Haimes Theatre

First Preview: January 3, 2025

Opening: January 23, 2025

Writer: Sanaz Toossi

Director: Knud Adams

About: Sanaz Toossi's Pulitzer Prize-winning play premieres on Broadway after an Off-Broadway run at Atlantic Theater Company

REDWOOD

Theatre: Nederlander Theatre

First Preview: January 24, 2025

Opening: February 13, 2025

Starring: Idina Menzel

Writers: Kate Diaz (music and lyrics), Tina Landau (concept, book and lyrics), Idina Menzel (concept and additional contributions)

Director: Tina Landau

About: Idina Menzel returns to Broadway in an original musical that premiered at La Jolla Playhouse in 2024.

PURPOSE

Theatre: Helen Hayes Theatre

First Preview: February 25, 2025

Opening: March 2025

Writer: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins

Director: Phylicia Rashad

About: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins' latest play arrives on Broadway after its sold-out premiere at Chicago's Steppenwolf Theatre Company.

BOOP! THE BETTY BOOP MUSICAL

Theatre: Broadhurst Theatre

First Preview: March 11, 2025

Opening: April 5, 2025

Writers: Bob Martin (book), David Foster (music), Susan Birkenhead (lyrics)

Director: Jerry Mitchell

About: A new musical based on the classic cartoon character created by Max Fleischer. Its premiere production, starring Jasmine Amy Rogers, played Chicago in November 2024.

THE LAST FIVE YEARS

Theatre: Hudson Theatre

First Preview: March 18, 2025

Opening: April 6, 2025

Starring: Nick Jonas, Adrienne Warren

Writers: Jason Robert Brown (book, music and lyrics)

Director: Whitney White

About: Jason Robert Brown's beloved musical about two New Yorkers falling in and out of love makes its Broadway debut.

STEPHEN SONDHEIM'S OLD FRIENDS

Theatre: Samuel J. Friedman Theatre

First Preview: March 25, 2025

Starring: Bernadette Peters, Lea Salonga

Writers: Stephen Sondheim (music and lyrics), Cameron Mackintosh (devisor)

Directors: Matthew Bourne, Julia McKenzie

About: The hit West End tribute to the late Stephen Sondheim comes to Broadway starring Broadway legends Bernadette Peters and Lea Salonga.

FLOYD COLLINS

Theatre: Vivian Beaumont Theatre

First Preview: March 27, 2025

Opening: April 21, 2025

Writers: Adam Guettel (music & lyrics), Tina Landau (book)

Director: Tina Landau

About: Lincoln Center Theater will present the Broadway debut of the award-winning Off-Broadway musical based on the true story of a man trapped in a cave.

STRANGER THINGS: THE FIRST SHADOW

Theatre: Marquis Theatre

First Preview: March 28, 2025

Opening: April 22, 2025

Writers: Kate Trefry (writer & original story), The Duffer Brothers (story), Jack Thorne (story)

Directors: Stephen Daldry (director), Justin Martin (co-director)

About: The prequel to the hit Netflix series comes to Broadway after its Olivier Award-winning opening in London's West End.

THE PIRATES OF PENZANCE

Theatre: Todd Haimes Theatre

First Preview: April 4, 2025

Opening: April 24, 2025

Starring: Ramin Karimloo, David Hyde Pierce

Writers: Arthur Sullivan (music), W.S. Gilbert (libretto), Rupert Holmes (adaptation)

Director: Scott Ellis

About: Gilbert & Sullivan's classic comic operetta is brought to life on Broadway for the first time in over 40 years.

ANNOUNCED FOR 2024-2025 SEASON WITHOUT CONFIRMED DATE OR VENUE

GLENGARRY GLEN ROSS

First Preview: Spring 2025

Starring: Kieran Culkin, Bob Odenkirk, Bill Burr

Writers: David Mamet

Director: Patrick Marber

About: David Mamet's classic play about cutthroat real estate agents returns to Broadway this spring.

GOOD NIGHT, AND GOOD LUCK

First Preview: Spring 2025

Starring: George Clooney

Writers: George Clooney and Grant Heslov

Director: David Cromer

About: George Clooney will make his Broadway debut in a stage adaptation of his 2005 film, about Edward R. Murrow's television crusade against Senator Joseph McCarthy.

OTHELLO

First Preview: Spring 2025

Starring: Denzel Washington, Jake Gyllenhaal, Molly Osborne

Writer: William Shakespeare

Director: Kenny Leon

About: Denzel Washington will play Othello and Jake Gyllenhaal will play Iago in Shakespeare's tragedy of jealousy and deception.

THE PICTURE OF DORIAN GRAY

First Preview: Spring 2025

Starring: Sarah Snook

Writer: Kip Williams

Director: Kip Williams

About: Emmy Award winner Sarah Snook plays 26 characters in this adaptation of Oscar Wilde's classic novel.

MY SON'S A QUEER (BUT WHAT CAN YOU DO?)

Creative Team: Rob Madge (writer), Luke Sheppard (director)

About: Rob Madge's autobiographical solo show previously played the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and an Olivier Award-nominated run in London's West End.

SMASH

Creative Team: Marc Shaiman & Scott Wittman (score); Rick Elice & Bob Martin (book); Joshua Bergasse (choreographer); Susan Stroman (director); Robert Greenblatt, Neil Meron, Steven Spielberg, & Jennifer Hudson (producers)

About: Stage incarnation of the TV series depicting the creation of the fictional Marilyn Monroe musical Bombshell.

SUGAR DADDY

First Preview: 2025

Starring: Sam Morrison

Writer: Sam Morrison

Director: Stephen Brackett

About: Sam Morrison's solo play is about transforming grief into humor on a journey of love, loss, diabetes, seagull attacks, and a few extraordinary coincidences. It previously played at Edinburgh Festival Fringe and Off-Broadway's SoHo Playhouse.

ANNOUNCED FOR 2025-2026 SEASON WITHOUT CONFIRMED DATE OR VENUE

THE QUEEN OF VERSAILLES

Starring: Kristin Chenoweth

Writers: Stephen Schwartz (music & lyrics), Lindsey Ferrentino (book)

Director: Michael Arden

About: A new musical based on the 2012 documentary The Queen of Versailles about socialite Jacqueline Siegel. It premiered at Boston's Emerson Colonial Theatre in summer 2024.

WAITING FOR GODOT

Starring: Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter

Writer: Samuel Beckett

Director: Jamie Lloyd

About: Samuel Beckett's absurdist masterpiece returns to Broadway in a new production starring Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter, decades-long friends and stars of the "Bill & Ted" films.

IN THE WORKS

13 GOING ON 30

Creative Team: Josh Goldsmith and Cathy Yuspa (book), Alan Zachary and Michael Weiner (music and lyrics), Andy Fickman (director)

About: New musical based on the 2004 hit movie of the same title about a gawky teenage girl who uses “wishing dust” to transform herself into a glamorous adult.

17 AGAIN

Creative Team: Marco Pennette (book), music and lyrics by Alan Zachary and Michael Weiner (music and lyrics), Adam Shankman (director)

New musical based on the 2009 Zac Efron fantasy film about a man who gets to relive his youth.

A developmental lab was held in New York November 2016.

AIN'T SUPPOSED TO DIE A NATURAL DEATH

Creative Team: Melvin Van Peebles (book, music, and lyrics), Kenny Leon (director), Lia Vollack (producer), Mario Van Peebles (creative producer)

About: A revival of the 1971 Tony-nominated musical exploring the life of Black Americans in underserved city neighborhoods.

ALI

Creative Team: Clint Dyer (book, lyrics, director), Teddy Abrams (music), Q-Tip (music producer, co-lyricist), Richard Willis (producer)

About: A new musical celebrating the life and legacy of the heavyweight boxing champion and humanitarian Muhammad Ali. The production will premiere at Chicago's James M. Nederlander Theatre in spring 2025.

BEAT STREET

Creative Team: Nas (new material, producer), Arthur Baker (producer), Michael Holman (producer), Richard Fearn (producer)

About: A new musical based on the 1984 hip-hop film classic.

THE BODYGUARD

Creative Team: Alexander Dinelaris (book), Lawrence Kasdan (source material)

Cast: Deborah Cox

About: Musical adapted from the Whitney Houston film about a pop star who falls in love with her bodyguard.

Latest: Originally presented in London, the stage musical toured North American 2017–2018. Regional productions have been staged across the globe.

BORN FOR THIS

Creative Team: Charles Randolph-Wright, BeBe Winans, and Lisa D'Amour (book); BeBe Winans (music and lyrics); Charles Randolph-Wright (director); Ron Gillyard and MyDestiny Productions (producers)

About: A story of family, love and forgiveness told through the incredible true story of BeBe Winans. Born For This is the family-friendly and universal story for anyone who has ever yearned for something—for anyone who is looking to find their purpose in life.

COCO

Creative Team: Michael Giacchino (music), Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez (music & lyrics), Disney (producer)

About: A musical adaptation of the Pixar animated film that explores identity and legacy through Dia de los Muertos.

CRAZY RICH ASIANS

Creative Team: Helen Park (music), Amanda Green & Tat Tong (lyrics), Leah Nanako Winkler (book), Jon M. Chu (director), Warner Bros. Theatre Ventures (producer)

About: A musical adaptation of the hit Warner Bros. romantic comedy.

THE DEVIL WEARS PRADA

Creative Team: Elton John (music), Shaina Taub (lyrics), Paul Rudnick (book), Anna D. Shapiro (director), Kevin McCollum (producer)

About: New musical based on Lauren Weisberger’s 2003 novel and the 2006 film about a woman who becomes assistant to the notorious editor of a topline fashion magazine. A Chicago pre-Broadway tryout, starring Beth Leavel as Miranda Priestley and Taylor Iman Jones as Andy, ran July 19–August 21, 2022, at the James L. Nederlander Theatre.

DREAMGIRLS

Creative Team Tom Eyen (book and lyrics), Henry Krieger (music), Casey Nicholaw (director), Sonia Friedman (producer)

About: A New York transfer of the hit London revival.

GATSBY

Creative Team: Florence Welch (lyrics), Florence Welch and Thomas Bartlett (music), Martyna Majok (book), Jeanie O'Hare (story consultant), Rachel Chavkin (director), Sonya Tayeh (choreographer), Jordan Roth (producer)

About: A musical adaptation of F. Scott Fitzgerald's classic novel, which entered the public domain in 2021. It premiered at the American Repertory Theatre in Cambridge, MA, in 2024.

THE GREATEST SHOWMAN

Creative Team: Benj Pasek & Justin Paul (music and lyrics), Disney (producer)

About: A stage adaptation of the movie musical starring Hugh Jackman as P.T. Barnum.

THE GRISWOLDS' BROADWAY VACATION

Creative Team: David Rossmer and Steve Rosen (book, music, and lyrics), Donna Feore (director and choreographer), Ken Davenport (producer)

About: Based on the characters from the Warner Bros. movie franchise, the musical made its world premiere in Fall 2022 at the 5th Avenue Theatre in Seattle.

HELLO, I'M DOLLY

Creative Team: Dolly Parton (book, music, and lyrics), Maria S. Schlatter (book), Bartlett Sher (director), Ken Davenport (producer)

About: A new biomusical inspired by the life and career of Grammy-winning singer-songwriter Dolly Parton. It was announced to open on Broadway in 2026.

HIGH NOON

Creative Team: Eric Roth (playwright), Michael Arden (director)

About: Based on Stanley Kramer’s trailblazing 1952 Academy Award-winning film, High Noon will become the first Western play to premiere on Broadway in over 85 years.

HIPPEST TRIP: THE SOUL TRAIN MUSICAL

Creative Team: Dominique Morisseau (book), Kamilah Forbes (director), Camille. Brown (choreographer), Ahmir “Questlove” Thompson, Tony Cornelius, Anthony E. Zuiker, and Shawn Gee (executive producers)

About: The story of producer Don Cornelius, who created the long-running TV variety show Soul Train with a score including soul and R&B songs showcased in the series. A world premiere production is scheduled to premiere at ACT in San Francisco in August 2022.

IMITATION OF LIFE

Creative Team: John Legend (music & lyrics), Lynn Nottage (book), Liesl Tommy (director), Universal Theatrical Group (producer)

About: A new musical based on the Fannie Hurst novel that inspired two Universal feature films.

IN DREAMS

Creative Team: Roy Orbison (songs), David West Read (book), Luke Sheppard (director)

About: A jukebox musical featuring the songs of rock and roll singer-songwriter Roy Orbison. It is scheduled to play in England and Toronto with Lena Hall in the lead role.

THE INTERESTINGS

Creative Team: Sara Bareilles (music & lyrics), Sarah Ruhl (book), Matt Ross (producer)

About: A new musical based on the Meg Wolitzer novel.

THE KARATE KID

Creative Team: Drew Gasparini (music and lyrics), Robert Mark Kamen (book), Amon Miyamoto (director)

About: A new musical based on the 1984 Columbia Pictures film inspired by Robert Mark Kamen’s original, semi-autobiographical story. It had its pre-Broadway production at STAGES St. Louis’ Kirkwood Performing Arts Center starring John Cardoza, Kate Baldwin, Alan H. Green.

LA LA LAND

Creative Team: Justin Hurwitz (music), Benj Pasek & Justin Paul (lyrics), Ayad Akhtar & Matthew Decker (book), Bartlett Sher (director)

About: A stage adaptation of Damien Chazelle's Academy Award-winning movie musical.

LAST SUMMER AT BLUEFISH COVE

Creative Team: Jane Chambers (playwright); Cynthia Nixon (director); Harriet Newman Leve, Ellen DeGeneres, Portia de Rossi, Lily Tomlin and Jane Wagner (producers)

About: It’s 1980 at Bluefish Cove: a lesbian beachside haven. Lil Zalinski and her close knit group of friends take refuge here each summer to live and love freely. When a straight woman named Eva wanders unknowingly into their midst, she sends The Cove into a tailspin and knocks Lil off her feet. The play made its world premiere 40 years ago Off-Broadway.

LIKE WATER FOR CHOCOLATE

Creative Team: Book by Lisa Loomer (book), Laura Esquivel (source material), La Santa Cecilia (music), La Santa Cecilia and Quiara Alegría Hudes (lyrics), Michael Mayer (director)

About: An exclusive preview of two songs from the musical debuted during ¡Viva Broadway! Hear Our Voices in October 2020.

THE LOST BOYS

Creative Team: The Rescues (music & lyrics), David Hornsby & Chris Hoch (book), Michael Arden (director)

About: A new stage adaptation of the 1987 cult classic film about a gang of teenage vampires.

MAGIC MIKE

Creative Team: Trip Cullman (director)

About: A stage adaptation of Steven Soderbergh's film about male strippers. A private workshop was held April 2015 featuring Derek Klena and Taylor Louderman. A December 2019 premiere in Boston was canceled May 23, 2019.

MARIE, DANCING STILL: A NEW MUSICAL

Creative Team: Lynn Ahrens and Stephen Flaherty (score), Susan Stroman (director and choreographer)

About: Formerly known as Little Dancer, the musical about Degas and ballerina Marie had a production at Seattle's 5th Avenue Theatre March 22–April 14, 2019, starring Tiler Peck, Terrence Mann, Karen Ziemba, Louise Pitre, Dee Hoty, and Jenny Powers.

MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL

Creative Team: Jason Robert Brown (score); Taylor Mac (book); Rob Ashford (director); Tanya Birl (choreographer); Hal Luftig, Craig Haffner, and Sherry Wright (producers)

About: A musical adaptation of John Berendt's 1994 Pulitzer finalist novel. It will premiere at Chicago's Goodman Theatre in summer 2024.

THE MOUSETRAP

Writers: Agatha Christie (playwright)

About: The world's most successful and longest-running play comes to Broadway for the very first time in a limited engagement.

NANCY DREW AND THE MYSTERY AT SPOTLIGHT MANOR: A MUSICAL

Creative Team: Sarah Kernochan (book), Alan Menken (music), Nell Benjamin (lyrics), James Lapine (director)

About: A live stage adaptation based on the beloved teen girl detective.

THE NANNY

Creative Team: Fran Drescher and Peter Marc Jacobson (book), Rachel Bloom and the late Adam Schlesinger (score), Marc Bruni (director)

About: A musical based on the popular sitcom series that ran during the '90s, starring Drescher.

OBSESSED, THE STORY OF DIANE WARREN…SO FAR

Creative team: Joe DiPietro (book), Kathleen Marshall (director)

About: A new musical based on the incredible life of Diane Warren, one of the most famous and successful songwriters of all time.

PAL JOEY

Creative Team: Richard Rodgers (music), Lorenz Hart (lyrics), John O'Hara (original book), Richard LaGravenese (new book), Savion Glover & Tony Goldwyn (directors)

About: The primary setting for this classic musical has been re-imagined as a South Side Chicago nightclub in the 1940s; the character of Linda, formerly a stenographer-clerk, is now an aspiring singer.

PARTICLE FEVER

Creative Team: Bear McCreary and Zoe Sarnak (music & lyrics), David Henry Hwang (book), Leigh Silverman (director), Megan Kingery and Annie Roney (producers)

About: A musical based on the particle physics documentary of the same name, telling the story of the discovery of the "God particle."

PURPLE RAIN

Creative Team: Prince (music & lyrics), Branden Jacobs-Jenkins (book), Lileana Blain-Cruz (director), Orin Wolf (producer)

About: A new stage adaptation of Prince’s legendary film and album, depicting an up-and-coming rock musician. The show will premiere in spring 2025 in Prince's hometown of Minneapolis.

THE QUEEN'S GAMBIT

Creative team: Mitski (music & lyrics), Eboni Booth (book), Whitney White (director)

About: A new musical based on the 1983 novel, which was also adapted into a hit Netflix miniseries.

THE SECRET GARDEN

Creative Team: Lucy Simon (music), Marsha Norman (book and lyrics), Warren Carlyle (director)

About: Revival of the 1991 musical based on Frances Hodgson Burnett’s story about an orphan girl who finds renewal when she discovers a locked, dead garden and brings it back to life. A co-production of Seattle's 5th Avenue Theatre and Shakespeare Theatre Company in Washington D.C., the Broadway-bound revival also played a stint in Houston October.

SIDEWAYS

Creative Team: Rex Pickett (book), Anthony Adams (composer)

About: A brand-new musical, mounted by EFG-Renascence Productions, based on Pickett’s novel that was adapted into an Oscar-winning film and a play.

SIDNEY

Creative team: Charles Randolph-Wright (playwright), Ruben Santiago-Hudson (director)

About: A new play about the life of Oscar winner and Tony nominee Sidney Poitier, based on Poitier's best-selling autobiography The Measure of a Man.

SINATRA THE MUSICAL

Creative Team: Joe DiPietro (book), Kathleen Marshall (director)

About: A new musical based on the life and career of the legendary artist Frank Sinatra. A premiere production starring Matt Doyle will open at England's Birmingham Rep in September 2023.

SING STREET

Creative Team: Gary Clark and John Carney (music & lyrics), Enda Walsh (book), Rebecca Taichman (director)

About: The show, based on the 2016 film, explores the power of first love and music against the backdrop of 1980s Dublin. It previously played productions Off-Broadway and in Boston.

SLIPPIN' THROUGH THE CRACKS

Creative Team: Bobby Rush (music & lyrics), Bobby Rush & Stephen Lloyd Helper (book), Stephen Lloyd Helper & Arminda Thomas (co-directors)

About: An autobiographical musical about Grammy-winning blues musician Bobby Rush.

STUDIO 54 THE MUSICAL

Creative Team: Chad Hodge (book), Sergio Trujillo (director & choreographer), Robert Greenblatt and Neil Meron (producers)

About: A musical about the legendary New York City nightclub.

THE TEN

Creative Team: Future Cut and Emily Phillips (music & lyrics), Nambi E. Kelley (book), Ruben Santiago-Hudson (director), Ken Davenport, Primary Wave Music, Sandi Moran (producers)

About: A new musical loosely based on Moses and the Ten Commandments and inspired by the power and spiritual energy of gospel.

THELMA & LOUISE

Creative Team: Neko Case (music & lyrics), Callie Khouri & Haley Feiffer (book), Trip Cullman (director)

About: A musical adaptation of the beloved 1991 about two friends on the run from the law. Amanda Seyfried is attached to perform in a workshop.

A TRANSPARENT MUSICAL

Creative Team: Faith Soloway (music & lyrics), MJ Kaufman & Joey Soloway (book), Amazon Studios & Eva Price (producers)

About: A new musical inspired by the hit Amazon Prime television series.

UNTITLED GIULIA TOFANA MUSICAL

Creative Team: Jennifer Nettles (music), Adam Zotovich (producer)

About: The country star has her eye on bringing another merry murderess to the stage: 17th-century professional poisoner Giulia Tofana.
